edu.northwestern.at.utils.csv
Class CSVFileWriter

java.lang.Object
  edu.northwestern.at.utils.csv.CSVFile
      edu.northwestern.at.utils.csv.CSVFileWriter

public class CSVFileWriter
extends CSVFile

CSVFileWriter writes text fields to a delimiter separate file.

Author:
Fabrizio Fazzino

Modifications by Philip R. Burns at Northwestern University.

  1. Allow output column selection and ordering.
  2. Allow specification of file character encoding.
  4. Use List instead of Vector.

separator - Field separator.
qualifier - Qualifier character. Ascii 0 means no qualifier.

public void writeFields(java.util.List<?> fields)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Write all fields to a new line in the CSV file.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

writeFields

public void writeFields(java.util.List<?> fields,
                        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> indices)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Write selected fields to a new line in the CSV file.

Parameters:
fields - The list of entries for this line.
indices - List of integer indices of entries to output.

The integer "indices" specify which entries to write out, and the order. For example, if "indices" contains the values 3, 4, 1 then entries 3, 4, and 1 from "fields" are written out in that order. Bad indices result in an empty field being output.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

writeFields

public void writeFields(java.util.List<?> fields,
                        int[] indices)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Write selected fields to a new line in the CSV file.

Parameters:
fields - The list of entries for this line.
indices - Array of integer indices of entries to output.

The integer "indices" specify which entries to write out, and the order. For example, if "indices" contains the values 3, 4, 1 then entries 3, 4, and 1 from "fields" are written out in that order. Bad indices result in an empty field being output.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
